description.value:
The world is filled with countless religious and magical denominations and forms of belief.  This information is no secret to a cleric, and often their interactions with such differing forms of belief or magic can affect their magics themselves.  

The following is a list of viewpoints on contradictory beliefs.  When you take this ability, choose one of the following forms of belief, as well as the trait with it.  

To change your character’s form of belief, you must reach a philosophical breakthrough as a Long Rest Action.  When you do, you lose access to the trait of your previous Clerical Approach, and may choose another one.  This process is mentally taxing, and you cannot make the change again until 1 month after choosing a Clerical Approach.  

 

Exclusivism 

Exclusivist clerics are those that believe that there is only one “correct” truth or form of belief, and that the beliefs of others are counterfeits or corruptions of the truth.  

 

Trait: When you prepare spells for the day, you can prepare 2 extra spells.  

When damaged by a spell that you have prepared from your cleric spell list, you can spend your reaction to halve the spell’s damage to yourself.  

 

Inclusivism

Inclusivists believe that all forms of faith or belief point to a singular truth, encouraged by similarities and downplaying differences between different faiths.  

 

Trait: As an action, you can replicate onto yourself the effects of a concentration spell that you can see affecting another creature within 30ft of you.  The effect only lasts until the start of your next turn.  

If the spell is of a higher spell level than you can cast, the initial action costs 2 Mana.  

 

Pluralism

Pluralists make little distinction between faiths. Each is valid to the particular cultures or groups that follow them.  

 

Trait: When a creature casts a non-concentration spell within 60ft of you, you can replicate the spell once within 1 minute of the spell happening at the Mana cost of 2 + the Mana cost of the spell.  

You cannot replicate 8th or 9th level spells.  

 

Syncretism

Syncretists carry a unique faith based on their personal life context, believing bits and pieces of numerous different beliefs that best fit their viewpoints and experiences.  

 

Trait: You learn 1 cantrip from any spell list.  Additionally, for each spell level that you become able to cast or have been able to cast above 1st, add a non-Cleric spell to your Cleric spell list. These spells can be prepared and count as Cleric spells, and use Wisdom as their spellcasting ability.

You cannot gain access to non-Cleric spells of 8th or 9th level this way.

system.requirements: Must have the Cleric Starter Abilities
